I was able to get close-ups and distance shots with one camera. If you are looking for something better than your phone camera and better than the low end point and shoot, this camera is for you.

Reviews.Title: Comparing the SX50-HS & Panasonic DMC-FZ70
Reviews.Author: Vanamali Ashram "Hari Aum"
Reviews.Content: Check out the set of photos I took this morning & uploaded to this page comparing the SX50-HS & Panasonic DMC-FZ70. The  comparison was done in Intelligent Automatic, Hand held, pictures taken within seconds of each other. Cannon takes sharper images, with more dynamic range & depth of field. I will be returning the Panasonic  FZ-70. ..too bad... Panasonic FZ70 didn't advance the state of the art...

Reviews.Title: Great Price for Quality Camera
Reviews.Author: David P.
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife and the 60X zoom is fantastic. We will be traveling from AZ to AK and we'll see how the animal pics turn out. She had a pervious version of this camera and loved it. It's a little bulky, but mainly because of the 1200mm zoom capability.

Reviews.Title: very good...
Reviews.Author: Deyvar Aponte
Reviews.Content: excellent camera, the zoom is amazing, plus its effects on photographs very useful, I am delighted with my camera, I recommend ...

Reviews.Title: Had problems with noise and image quality
Reviews.Author: CMac -Amazon Addict!
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth Panasonic Lumix camera - I have stepped up from one of the first Bridge cameras that they offered, and I loved them. That is until, I got this one. My last camera is the DMC-FZ100. I wanted the upgraded zoom and megapixels. Let me say that the camera does have good points. The weight of the camera is a nice beefy feeling, and makes you aware that you have a camera in your hands. The zoom is INCREDIBLE! Wow,,,it almost breaks my heart to return it because the zoom is so amazing.There is a hot shoe for an external flash. That is about where my "WOW factor".Panasonic made a decision to leave items off of this camera items that had a GREAT purpose and now they are gone. Things like the tilt screen,,,the external MIC plug, the macro setting on the setting wheel is gone, and now must be found in the setting menu (it's easy to find, but it used to be easier to just turn the setting wheel). But the tilt screen gone? Why? Having a bridge camera is the reason why folks like me LOVE having a tilt screen. Most of us are amateur photographers, we LIKE the tilt screen! We don't want to manipulate the different lenses,,,many don't like having to mess with manual focus or settings to control many things. I for one like the ability to change my settings manually,,,but,,,I'm also only 5ft tall, I can't get many shots that taller folks can get. But, give me a tilt screen and I can hold the camera up in the air, tilt the screen down, and see what I want for a decent picture,,,that has been taken away.That being said,,,I could live with it when I saw the zoom ability! I loved it!!! I could see birds hiding in trees from quite a distance! WOW - I was a happy shutter bug! Then I started to use the camera. The zoom focus was sluggish and super slow (it was not supposed to be this way). I played around with the settings, and was hoping that this would change, it didn't. But, I dealt with it, and started taking pictures,,,the back screen was almost invisible in bright sunlight, so I switched to the view finder. Getting my full view was a bit difficult for me, but I got the shots that I wanted. It was a clear, bright sunny day, not a cloud in the sky and spring cherry tree blooms were screaming for their picture to be taken. Out of 128 pictures taken from my walk, over half had to be deleted. This was an anomaly that had never taken place in my photoshop menu before. The ones that I did keep, all had to be manually adjusted for clarity. I was upset. I had such high expectations for this model camera. I was willing to give up certain items, in a swap for that awesome zoom capability, but the quality that was lacking in the photos themselves, was just not worth it. Many people have raved at this model, and the pictures that it takes. Perhaps I just got a bad camera? I don't know. I cannot be sure. And, I'm not willing to take that chance. I will be waiting for a different brand camera, to arrive on the market place in March. It will cost much more, but, at this point, I'd rather spend more money, and get everything that I want in a camera.

Reviews.Title: The good, the bad...and the average
Reviews.Author: William Moore
Reviews.Content: For a light weight digital camera it is good for some events and not so much for others.  I've only had this camera for a month as a backup to my higher end cameras.  From the lower zoom to about the 500 mm zoom the photos are good when shot in RAW (JPG starts to get fuzzy and grainy early in the 30x zoom range and because I take a lot of nature and landscape photos the 500 to 1200 (60x range) the photos quality diminishes. I'm comparing the quality with higher-end DSLR cameras/lens and that might not be fair since this is not promoted as comparable. Close up and objects not more than 100-150 feet the camera is good.  I would not recommend this camera if you are looking for overall great optics and low pixelation (the effect caused by zooming in on a photo making pixels visible). Shooting in the RAW mode does help however it uses up a lot of memory and battery (fewer photos on a memory card and battery drainage).  I've been shooting since the early 1970 (film) and digital higher end DSLR's from the very early 2000's.  I'll keep experimenting to see if I can improve the photo quality to the point I would like it to be... but until then "It's O.K." (3 stars) is the best I can give it.

Reviews.Title: Battery Drain
Reviews.Author: B. mckinley "coffee nut"
Reviews.Content: The first camera I received drained a fully charged battery after 4 photos and would not take video, it just shut off and said change the batteries. I received a replacement camera (great customer service amazon!) and it is working as expected. Took about 60 pics and some video with 1 fully charged battery (still have some battery left).  Sounds like they have some lemons out there.  I really like the camera, the zoom is great takes great pics.  Make sure you get a good one!!

Reviews.Title: My Third Panasonic
Reviews.Author: Cat Lady
Reviews.Content: The super long optical zoom, plus the digital zooms (which in the programmable modes lets you shoot the craters on the moon), make this a great camera for people who like to shoot wildlife and scenes that are far away.  I'm still learning some of the changes between this and my last super zoom but overall I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: I am very pleased with this camera.
Reviews.Author: Donald E. Dimock
Reviews.Content: The camera exceeded my expectations.  I do nature photography.  With that much zoom I can take photos of birds farther away than I could before.  The images are sharp.  The three negative criticisms I have are that it saves RAW images as RW2.  I prefer adjusting the zoom by hand instead of the power driven zoom.  And there is no lens hood.  But I am still very pleased with the camera and give it a top rating.

Reviews.Title: Better than sliced bread!
Reviews.Author: William I. Marsh
Reviews.Content: It is beyond my greatest expectations. Since I gave up on my old, very old Maxxum 7000 and went to digital it does all the things the 7000 did and so much more.I especially like being able to change the ISO settings which enables me to take inside pictures without using flash. The manual is huge and I'm still constantly referring to it. It will go to Hawaii in November (the manual) where I expect the make full use of all the abilities of the camera.The $400 price just blows my mind.

Reviews.Title: Another nice camera in this family.
Reviews.Author: rlm
Reviews.Content: Although I only have had this a few weeks it is a very nice camera. The zoom features are awesome it will amaze you how good of images at max zoom even when hand held. The only thing I am not sure of is the selector/adjustor wheel if this mechanism proves to be reliable then I think we have another winner here.

Reviews.Title: Unbeatable for dollar spent!!
Reviews.Author: Paul Brown
Reviews.Content: This is my third DMC-series Lumix. I love them. For price, image quality, flexibility and ease of operation they can't be beat. I managed a lot of shots in Africa while the SLR crowd was fumbling with lenses that cost three- to five-times (or more) what my whole camera cost. If you are all about heavy, insanely expensive GEAR, buy an SLR. If you are about images, this camera is a delightful tool to use.

Reviews.Title: A great camera!
Reviews.Author: Harry
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! I have all kinda of cameras and lenses but when it comes down to it I don't want to carry them around! This is everything in one!

Reviews.Title: Great value, Awsome zoom
Reviews.Author: Robert Didner "Ballchaser"
Reviews.Content: Let's me take the great extreme telephoto & wide angle shots with little WA distortion & minor chromatic aberration at extreme tele.  The user interface is somewhat awkward and difficult to learn & I would like to see more range of f stops for greater control over depth of field, particularly at the small aperture range (f8 doesn't do it for me, it should go down to f22 at least).

Reviews.Title: I am thrilled with this camera thus far!
Reviews.Author: Jonathan C. Ross
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a zoom! I added on another zoom lens that attaches right to the front of the existing lense, with no adapters or anything needed, and now I have over 100X zoom on a compact digital camera! Now, I am not a professional photographer by any means, and can't tell you any technical stuff, but this camera is AWESOME! I had two Nikon DSLR's in the past, and they were just very complicated and very heavy for me to use all the time, this is fairly lightweight, and takes stunning photos. I'm in love. Between this and my LX7 I am set for awhile with cameras!

Reviews.Title: My second Panasonic camera
Reviews.Author: HARI SELDON "LEN"
Reviews.Content: I own a Canon SLR, two Fuji bridge cameras, two Olympus point and shoot and one other Panasonic pocket point and shoot.By far, this is the best camera I have.  Love the zoom (WOW!!)  Really great stabilization.I am shooting the neighbors flowers one petal at a time.Really love this camera.

Reviews.Title: 60x optical zoom. WOW
Reviews.Author: Kerry "Kerry"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a couple of weeks now and have shot about 1500 photos with it.  I wanted a bridge camera that had a longer zoom than my fz200, didn't break the bank and was small and light enough to actually keep with me.  At 60x, fz70 has almost twice the optical zoom of my fz200 and I can still use the doubling lens I bought for the fz200 once I purchase an adapter if I need more than a 1200mm zoom.  Don't get me wrong, I love the fz200, the low light capabilities of the fz70 doesn't compare but the 60x zoom is nothing short of amazing.  The picture quality is fine for my needs (snapshots, travel photos, birding shots) and the camera is light enough to keep in my backpack.  I am a novice birder and the ability to get a decent picture of a bird a good distance away is helping me learn to id what I was missing before.  I am more than happy with this camera.Pros:- Did I mention it has a 60x optical zoom?- Small enough to keep with me.  Can't get great pics if the camera is sitting at home.- Picture quality is decent.  Not as good as the fz200 but you don't pay as much for this camera either.Cons:- Battery life.  Not great.  Can be extended by dimming the screen and turning off the setting to keep the focus motor going.- File name conflicts.  Since I own two Panasonic cameras I have to be creative when importing photos.  There is no way to alter the file naming convention of PXXXXXXX.JPG so it is easy to overwrite files if both cameras are being used.  There is a site online that tells how to jump ahead in the numbering schema but that is just putting off the problem. [...]  I've resorted to uploading the files from this camera to a specific folder then running a script to change the filename from PXXXXXX.JPG to QXXXXXX.JPG.  An extra step I wish I didn't have to remember to do.

Reviews.Title: Middle price and use bridge type camera.
Reviews.Author: literblu
Reviews.Content: great "bridge" type camera. lots of great features even for a beginner. software for editing a little "lax", but over-all very good for home use. will be taking to sons college graduation.  Practice with settings and feel before you "need" it.  Have not printed yet but am encouraged.  very glad of purchase after much review about features and price.  HAPPY

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Tim Beaudet "Tim Beaudet"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great step up from a simple point and shoot, while keeping all the usefulness of a point and shoot.  The zoom is incredible, and of course requires steady hands to get the best shot possible.  That said, the image stabilizer helps and you can actually take reasonably clear shots zoomed in by hand.  I was at a ball game the other night, and from my seat, the entire park fit in the frame of a single picture.  Zooming in, without digital zoom (60x), the batter would fill more than the screen and I was able to see footprints in the dirt...I also took the camera to the races, and after a handful of attempts was able to get a classic picture with a clear car and blurry background.  That takes a little more skill to accurately track the car so it remains clear.  Easy to use, and the battery life actually lasted much, MUCH, longer than I was expecting.  Leaving the camera on, allowing it to sleep when it wants, I would be able to take fairly nonstop pictures all day I did buy 2 extra (generic) batteries as I plan to take this on a two week trip to Peru, but I am confident that it will have enough life.  The camera does have some weight to it but is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Tim Beaudet "Tim Beaudet"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great step up from a simple point and shoot, while keeping all the usefulness of a point and shoot.  The zoom is incredible, and of course requires steady hands to get the best shot possible.  That said, the image stabilizer helps and you can actually take reasonably clear shots zoomed in by hand.  I was at a ball game the other night, and from my seat, the entire park fit in the frame of a single picture.  Zooming in, without digital zoom (60x), the batter would fill more than the screen and I was able to see footprints in the dirt...I also took the camera to the races, and after a handful of attempts was able to get a classic picture with a clear car and blurry background.  That takes a little more skill to accurately track the car so it remains clear.  Easy to use, and the battery life actually lasted much, MUCH, longer than I was expecting.  Leaving the camera on, allowing it to sleep when it wants, I would be able to take fairly nonstop pictures all day I did buy 2 extra (generic) batteries as I plan to take this on a two week trip to Peru, but I am confident that it will have enough life.  The camera does have some weight to it but is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: joseluiscajo
Reviews.Content: Nice Camera, full HD pics and Video, not as heavy as las lumix versions. I am really happy to have it.

Reviews.Title: Chain Saw Bob
Reviews.Author: Chain Saw Bob
Reviews.Content: This one of the greatest camera that I have seen for the money. This is a lot more camera then a first timer needs. We on a cruise and this took great picture way our there. And very clear.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I've EVER owned.
Reviews.Author: Sue A Gray
Reviews.Content: Takes the BEST pictures I've ever taken.  Clear, Brilliant Color, Just over all the BESTI would recommend this camera to everyone that wants exceptional photos!!!!

Reviews.Title: What a lens!!
Reviews.Author: wackezoid
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera that can do about everything there is to do for stills.  Video I don't know.  Auto focus is iffy at the long end so expect to shoot several shots to get a good one.  Also don't expect DSLR image quality.  The tiny pixels in the sensor mean artifacts in the image if you insist on diving in beyond 100%.  The lens runs from ultra wide 20 mm equivalent to 1200.  Wow!!

Reviews.Title: I mainly complain about chromatic aberration
Reviews.Author: Some_other_guy
Reviews.Content: It is a very good camera for the price BUT I would not buy it again for some reasons:1. The quality of the lens is not very good, there is a lot of chromatic aberration whenever you use the optical zoom.2. As happened with another Lumix I had (FZ30), there is a lot of noise whenever you use an ISO higher than 100. I compared images taken with this camera and a Canon Powershot A710is (under the same circumstances and similar settings) and when you amplify the image in your monitor at the point that you can see the pixels, there is a lot more noise on the images taken with the Lumix.Other than that, the video is very nice, and the optical zoom is simply unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: So far have had no issues with this camera. The optical zoom is great. Look forward to trying more with it.

Reviews.Title: Does not meet the hype, but a good oversized $150 camera for $300 bucks
Reviews.Author: J. J. Lawrence "JL13"
Reviews.Content: Although I have a fair amount of experience with 35mm photography, this is my first “non-pocket” digital camera. After reading a lot of the reviews on Amazon and other places on the web, as well as watching too many You Tube videos, I came to the conclusion that the FZ70 would be a good, affordable  replacement for my aging 35mm Cannon SLR.  Now I’m not sure I read and watched enough.  After it arrived in a timely fashion, I set about playing with my new toy. You know- local landscapes, the cat, my wife, shots taken indoors and out, cloudy and sunny days. Hand-held and on a tripod. It is lightweight and compact given that huge piece of glass on the front. It comes with everything you need to start except a case and SD card. But the best I can give this camera is 3 stars.  First, there is no remote shutter release system available for this camera. While there are enough automatic modes and settings to keep you busy learning until the unit is obsolete and it has to be replaced, the manual mode settings are limited. Tech support is rather lackluster. It took them 45 minutes to answer one question, including the time it took them to give me the answer to a question someone else asked. The basic paper manual you receive with the camera is difficult to follow and it (along with the “Advanced Manual” you can download from the Panasonic website) is more concerned with taking video than stills.  It takes “OK” photos- good but the color and focus never seems quite correct, especially when taking pictures that require a long depth of field. I also can’t notice much effect using their stabilization system. I can most closely compare them to a $150 dollar pocket camera.  I can’t return it because I am leaving for the Grand Canyon next week and will not have time.  While disappointed, I guess I have no one to blame but myself. I just don’t know how much more research I could have done. If this camera doesn’t work out, I’ll dump it on Craig’s List (for a loss) and invest in a SLR or maybe just get a high-end pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the dollar
Reviews.Author: Paul J Varian
Reviews.Content: I have a DSLR and I have a pocket camera. The pocket camera does what it was designed to do. Sit in your pocket and take pictures. They were never great but...I purchased the DMC-FZ70 after several weeks of research and I must say I am very impressed. I have had it for three weeks now and I am still finding new features. In fact the only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because I have to "find" the new features the manual could be better in explaining all the camera does. Shooting in RAW format is great and works well. Great camera smaller and lighter than a DSLR and much better quality pictures than a pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: ladymac
Reviews.Content: Just ordered, and received it in 1 day. The camera is everything if not more than I expected, the quality is tops. Photos are superb. Love the 3D settings, the panorama settings, everything.  I had a Canon SX50 HS before this, even though the pics were good and I hated the handling of it, sold it and bought this one. This one is tops in my books.

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: Bryan C Bopp
Reviews.Content: Great so far, awesome zoom, good quality and sharpness; still playing with some of the features. I've gotten some great bird shots and compliments on a close up of the moon.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Camilo Diaz
Reviews.Content: large magnifying lens 60xfocus while zoomingallows adjustment of focus and SLR camerasnot interchangeable lens fixedinternal memory of 4 gbhas all the modes and effects of a point and shoot cameraeasy to usecomes with protective lens cap, battery and strapmanual in multiple languagespacked in its original box.the display is not moveablebrings optical viewfinder.Recommended for intermediate photograph experiencegran lente de 60x de aumentoenfoca mientras se hace zoompermite ajustes de enfoque como camaras reflexde lente fijo no intercambiablela memoria interna de 4 gbtiene todos los modos y efectos de una camara apunta y disparafacil de usarviene con tapa protectora de lente, bateria y correacon manual en multiples lenguajesempacada en su caja original.la pantalla es fijatrae visor optico.recomendada para el fotografo de experiencia intermedio

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Marco Jimenez E
Reviews.Content: This cam is a very good electronic device. The incredible zoom and the quality of the pictures makes satisfied of this choice.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jewel
Reviews.Content: I have been a fan of the Panasonic Lumix Cameras for years. This is my third one, and it's a beauty. Also it uses the same memory cards and battery that the DMC-FZ40 did. The 60X zoom is amazing.

Reviews.Title: A terrific camera!!
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: An outstanding camera at an excellent price.  Just as good as my professional Canon.  I am surprised at how good it is.  Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Quite good.
Reviews.Author: Ralph Freeman "Ralph Freeman"
Reviews.Content: If you plan on making 16 x 20 prints this isn't the camera for you.  You loose a lot to get that amazing zoom range.  For most folks it is a wonderful value.  Enjoy?

Reviews.Title: Son's Christmas Gift
Reviews.Author: Hobbes007
Reviews.Content: My son absolutely loves his camera.  It has many extras on it that I almost wished that I would have ordered one for my other son as well!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for carrying into the field
Reviews.Author: J. Hargrove "The Other Jim Hargrove"
Reviews.Content: For years, I've debated what camera to take birding. The choice is between being a BIRDER, that is, using binoculars to look at birds, and being a BIRD PHOTOGRAPHER, more interested in the great photo than spotting everything. Fortunately, I have had the good luck to travel with photographers, leaving me free to spend time looking. I've considered getting the gear necessary to take good photos, but the investment, both in dollars and weight, is significant.Finally, a camera comes along made for people like me. It is small and light enough to carry around all day, yet capable of taking great photos. The lens extends to provide 60x optical zooming, coupled with superior image stabilizing firmware that I find myself snapping away. If the birds are distant, well, you at least have a record shot. However, when you have one reasonably close, you may get a real keeper.I love this camera and it will be part of my birding equipment from now on.The only minor complaint I have is that it doesn't seem to have an option to recharge the battery using the USB cable, meaning that you have to pack yet another battery charger on a long trip.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and 60x zoom is awesome
Reviews.Author: George Ligus
Reviews.Content: I even dropped it down a 10 foot cliff with me behind it and it worked fine after the fall. However I do not recommend this. The 60x zoom hand held pictures are amazing. Easy to operate

Reviews.Title: Loved this camera.. Recommend It
Reviews.Author: George Shudes
Reviews.Content: A very nice camera. Very versatile  with the super zoom. Also very impressed with some of the special easy to use special effects like the background blur as well as others. Wish it had the adjustable viewer screen but I knew that before I purchased it..Fits well in the hand. Simple fast control buttons for the most used functions..

Reviews.Title: need the speed
Reviews.Author: Grampop "steve"
Reviews.Content: I need someone's help with this camera when I do shots at a basketball game I'm not sure of all the settings yet, can someone help I took a lot of pictures (outdoors ) but need help inside. The outdoor shots are great.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: JHONNY
Reviews.Content: Its a good camera, have an excelent resolution and extraordinary zoom, i hope dont have inconvenients and continue using by a good time this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Denise DeLitta "dunuchee"
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything I was looking for.  Light weight great zoom no changing lenses.  Only thing is can't figure out how to take a pic without the red flash even if I turn off red eye function. Otherwise LOVE IT, LOVE IT, LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: julie
Reviews.Content: Although this camera is bigger than I wanted, I already have a Canon, I love the quality of the photos, color, sharpness.  It is easy to use and I would recommend it if you dont mind the size.  I have big hands and it fits nicely for me.

Reviews.Title: Takes Wonderful Pictures
Reviews.Author: Sheila Newcomb "SLynn"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use.  The pictures are sharp/clear.  The only issue is the bag that was recommended for this camera - to me is a wee bit small.

Reviews.Title: Best all purpose camera with an affordable price.
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: Thanks for Mr. Gravett and the other's positive reviews. Finally purchased FZ70 and quickly verified how great was the power zoom  beyond the optical range at 132X.Please check out the IQ  at 132X zoom in flickr ---[...]

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly capable performer
Reviews.Author: S. Lionel
Reviews.Content: My usual style of camera is the "semi-pro" DSLR - I have a Canon 7D. Otherwise I go for small, pocketable cameras such as the Canon PowerShot S90. The Panasonic DMC-FZ70 is a camera style I have not tried before: lightweight, crammed full of features, significant manual controls and extreme zoom capabilities. I took it with me on a trip to a family event to see how it would shake out.I am not going to try to list every feature the DMC-FZ70 has, I'd be here all day. But here are the things that appealed to me:- Full manual controls available, including aperture and shutter priority modes- RAW image capability- Hot shoe for external flash- Separate button to start video recording - no need to "switch modes"- 60X optical zoom with optical stabilization- Enough control buttons and dials to satisfy a DSLR lover- Built-in panorama stitchingI used the DMC-FZ70 for both video and stills, and was very favorably impressed with the quality of each. I separately bought a PNY 64GB SDXC card which worked just fine. Curiously, the camera has 200MB of built-in storage, so it can take some photos and even short videos without a card. I selected MP4 as the video recording format because I thought that's what I would need for YouTube, though I later learned that the AVCHD mode, which is default, would have worked better. The videos were clear and smooth, and the recorded audio was just fine, with just a hint of wind noise. A wind noise suppression mode is available. There is a "zoom mic" mode that will, supposedly, allow you to record sounds from further away when zoomed out - I did not try that.Even though I often choose custom settings on my DSLR, I left the DMC-FZ70 in "AI" mode because I didn't want to distract myself from the events I was recording. This worked just fine, and I don't think I would have changed anything. Even in this mode, you can make minor adjustments such as depth-of-field and exposure compensation.I was very impressed with how far out the camera could zoom - even more is available if you want to get into digital zoom (which I avoid). The optical stabilization worked quite well, though at maximum zoom you're really going to want a tripod.I also tried the panorama mode, where you hold down the shutter button and swivel around as it takes many pictures and then stitches them together. This worked fine. I also used the self-timer feature to take a group photo (on a tripod).Is there anything about the DMC-FZ70 I didn't like? Yes. The supplied lens cap doesn't grip very well, but at least it's tethered. Going on the advice of another reviewer, I bought a third-party lens cap (and also a Sigma UV filter, which I put on all my lenses.) In addition to the crisp 3" display, there is an electronic viewfinder, but you have to switch between them.The Panasonic DMC-FZ70 is lightweight, compact and easy to carry. I can easily see myself taking this places I wouldn't take my DSLR. It would make a great vacation camera as a step up from a typical point-and-shoot, and has enough manual controls to satisfy all but the most die-hard DSLR fan.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive camera has amazing zoom feature.
Reviews.Author: Donald L. Romack
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. It is light, 16 mp and the zoom is fantastic. There are so many features that I will have to study the manual for a while to know how to use them all. I can hardly wait to take this camera on my next trip. I should get some amazing nature pictures. Zoom is 60x for optical and another 60x for digital (120x). Wide angle is 20 mm and it zooms out to 1200mm at full extension. I looked at various cameras with a mega zoom feature including the Canon SX50. This Lumix has most of the features of the Canon as well as a few extra, a larger optical zoom (60x as opposed to 50x on the Canon) and is priced about $35 less than the Canon. I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Did Panasonic seek photographer input with their decisions for the FZ70 /72 ??
Reviews.Author: R. Weissberg
Reviews.Content: I so much wanted this product to perform well. I like Panasonic cameras for many reasons. I own many.Many other reviews explore the virtues of this camera. As a photographer I want the camera to perform consistently. Focus and image stabilization should perform securely for the lens provided with the camera. I experienced random results with both the focus and lens stabilization at its 60X optical performance. Why have a lens which will not perform consistently handheld as it was intended to be used?Exposure should remain consistent through all automatic settings, Program, IA Auto, IA Auto Plus, Scene modes, Shutter Priority, Aperture Priority, The shutter and aperture may vary but the exposure should remain consistent. I did NOT experience this during my testing under the same lighting conditions.A smart bridge camera being used for this area between Point and Shoot and DSLR, should evaluate the position of the lens when considering exposure. If Sport recognizes the shutter should be set for 1/500th of a second with the lighting conditions and a lens at 60X optical, then all the auto functions should recognize that the lens extended to 60X optical requires 1/500th to capture an image without blur. This speed is inconsistent ranging from 1/125th to 1/500th of a second with the exact same lighting conditions. Perhaps engaging a beta testing photographer could have alerted the engineering staff of these inconsistencies before Panasonic brought this product into production.Most bridge users want raw image capability. Usually bridge camera users post process their images if they shoot raw. The software products bridge users employ for post processing are usually common and are capable of using plug-ins to extend the capacity to this software. Lightroom as I understand does not identify nor is able to use the FZ70 / 72 raw file. If i were a manufacturer, I would ensure the consumers of my product would be able to use my raw files universally in common software for their convenience. I checked the latest DNG release at Adobe, and their DNG converter did not support this camera. I am not aware that Panasonic has provided a raw file that is easily used.IA Plus auto mode. Why be able to adjust the IA Plus if the settings are not retained for future use? Fortunately, most of the scene modes allow this feature.I like the size and ergonomics of this camera. Buttons, Menus and controls are logically place.This a rough gem that has not been made into a jewel.The sensor appears to perform well to 1600 ISO with usable files for most purposes.I would like to encourage we Panasonic users to encourage Panasonic to develop a less noisy sensor instead of getting into the mega pixel race. 35 mm film resolved at approximately 8 megapixel. So a camera sensor at 16 megapixels is certainly sufficient for most of our purposes.The sensor in this camera seems to be less noisy than the 12 megapixel sensor in the FZ200. A marriage of these products would be a bridge camera gem.This is my non professional opinion. I am hopeful a better bridge product will be forthcoming from Panasonic. If not I'll have to explore the replacement for the Canon SX50, a camera with some shortcomings but with a usable raw file. Raw files are essential because jpeg wastes so much information when the image is saved. Raw files have to be able to be read by MAC or WINDOWS computers as well as software that these computers commonly use.Happy shopping. Sadly,my camera has to go back because it did not perform to my expectations. I'll have to see if something is offered in the bridge camera arena this Spring. The current bridge cameras are tooooo old because technology has evolved toooo rapidly.

Reviews.Title: point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: James Whalen
Reviews.Content: takes great pics close up and far away.  quality great an every light weight.  lens is attached so no head for changes lens. this is great for trips afar.

Reviews.Title: point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: James Whalen
Reviews.Content: takes great pics close up and far away.  quality great an every light weight.  lens is attached so no head for changes lens. this is great for trips afar.

Reviews.Title: Great camera--great price!
Reviews.Author: Purple Rose of Wamego
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera in all respects, and great value for the money.  It could use a vari-angle lens, but that's about my only suggestion at this point.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Sally Sue
Reviews.Content: I will give an A for this item! Works great and just love it !Would recommend it to anyone! Great!

Reviews.Title: present
Reviews.Author: bonbon
Reviews.Content: i bought this as a birthday present and my husband keeps telling me how great this camera is. i do know the zoom lens is very good

Reviews.Title: WONDERFULL!!!
Reviews.Author: Janpar1
Reviews.Content: JUST CAME BACK FROM TRIP.  THIS CAMERA IS AMAZING.  MUCH TO LEARN BUT THE AUTOMATIC SETTING CAN DO MOST OF WHAT IS NEEDED.  PICTURES AND VIDEO AT THE SAME TIME.  VERY FAST FOCUSING AAND FAST ZOOM.. PICTURE STABILIZED VERY WELL.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable performance
Reviews.Author: Nibornm
Reviews.Content: The capabilities of this camera come across as almost too good to be true.I'm glad to report that Lumix have done a great job.This camera performs really well in multiple conditions.Excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: Great Pics
Reviews.Author: rcarb
Reviews.Content: Have taken several pics in last 4-5 days and besides at first not knowing much about the camera it has done a great job as I learn more about all its abilitys. I figure i will only like it better as i Learn more about it.....I would recommend to friend.

Reviews.Title: What a GREAT camera for 98% of all my camera needs!!
Reviews.Author: Michael T
Reviews.Content: Yo-This replaces my 'old' Lumix DMC-FZ60 and gives me a greatly improved wider and way longer lens distance with somewhat better picture quality.This is not a small camera - has look and feel of a good SLR at a much more reasonable price point.I have and will continue to recommend this fine camera to all interested folks.

Reviews.Title: Delivers on all promises!
Reviews.Author: Gary Villette
Reviews.Content: I was considering getting the Nikon 520 due to it's slightly higher resolution but got this instead because of the much longer focal length zoom. I am impressed, and very glad I got this camera! The 60x zoom is fantastic for wildlife, and the image stabilization system works very well. I have taken handheld shots of the moon with decent results. The very wide angle end of the focal range is great for indoor social shots. The 'intelligent Auto' setting is just amazing and the autofocus is very customizable and very fast.

Reviews.Title: I love the zoom!
Reviews.Author: J. Ulrich
Reviews.Content: Taking pictures of objects at a distance is no problem for this camera. I already own a digital SLR camera and a 300mm zoom lens, but this approximates 600mm optical (1200mm digital) zoom, which is amazing! Holding the camera still at maximum zoom is always an issue - you need a tripod to get a clear picture, but when the conditions are right you can get that perfect shot with this camera. (And it is so much lighter than my digital SLR!)

Reviews.Title: Pictures soft at 60X.
Reviews.Author: BooBoo
Reviews.Content: The same problem we had when the FZ100 came out. The pictures were very soft (fuzzy), not good detail at full zoom. Then we purchased an FZ150 and the detail is excellent. We wanted the longer zoom, but were disappointed in the results. We sent it back. It seems when they increase the MP's along with the zoom, it's not a good match...

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-FZ70
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: For a non-professional camera it is excellent.  It is especially good for telephoto shots.  It is also light weight. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: C. Williams
Reviews.Content: It is a great camera and I look forward to its continuing use. The colors are great and the zoom is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Phillips
Reviews.Content: All about the zoom, baby!  The zoom really is incredible in this camera.  I need to experiment with it more, but so far very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Strange noise from the lens
Reviews.Author: Devek Maga
Reviews.Content: The camera is fantastic. I'm not going to repeat what others already wrote, but I wanted to add a few things:1. Panasonic is using a strange folders naming on the SD card where the video clips are hiding. It reminds me Sony. Never understood why it is needed to have the video clips (which are MTS files and not AVI, MOV or whatever you saw before) buried three levels down in the card.2. When the camera is turned ON, there is a strange noise that never stops but increases when the lens is extended. If you place your ear above the Mic, you can hear it well... When you switch the mode to Play, the noise goes away. It is there always and only when the camera is in capturing mode... all modes.3. The Flash shoe, as nice as it may be, does not work with all mountable flashes. I tried the Nikon SB600 and no joy. When I press the shutter button to take a picture, the flash resets and recharges, but there is no flash light... So the shutter causes the short to tell the flash to reset, but not receiving the command to fire it, strange.4. The lack of a lens hood is an issue, especially when you have a lot of light using the zoom. I found a rubber hood with a 55mm thread outside (that fits to the camera thread) and 55mm inside, so you can attach a filter to protect the lens. Of course, found it here on Amazon.I've added a few images of a mountain and cactus using the different zoom settings. You can find those images at the Users Gallery above.Although I have a few minor issues with the camera, I still gave it 5 stars because the number of features that are built into this body and the X60 zoom are just remarkable. I use a DSLR full time and adding this lens in a shape of a camera, as much as there is a difference between the two, is a great way to be more mobile. I am testing more features every day and will update this post with what I find.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: K. E. Smith
Reviews.Content: This is not my primary digital camera.  I also own a Nikon D300.  You cannot compare a high-end semi-pro camera with a point and shoot camera with a fixed zoom lens.  This Panasonic camera takes excellent pictures.  It is light-weight (Compared to my D300) and has a wealth of built-in controls to handle a variety of picture taking situations.  It takes a 55mm filter size.  The eyepiece view finder is just ok but I prefer to shoot with this rather than the 3" LCD viewer.  Note that the 3" LCD view screen is not bad at all.  Be careful about ordering some of the items listed with the camera.  One of the compact camera cases is too small.  Also some of the batteries listed are not for the FZ-70.  However this review is about the camera and it is a good camera for a beginner or a travel camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Telephoto But Awful Controls
Reviews.Author: Chris L
Reviews.Content: This is my third Lumix bridge camera.PROS- Amazing telephoto range that would have cost many thousands $$ on in equivalent DSLR lenses.- Good resolution for most of us non-professionals.  I have enlarged to 20"x 30" and would grade print resolution quality a 85%...pretty good for a home wall picture but won't be acceptable for a billboard in Times Square.- Even though its larger and heavier than its predecessors, its still much lighter than an equivalent DSLR.- FINALLY FINALLY has standard size filters.CONS- Terrible controls.  Everything hinges upon the wheel - turn the wheel, click the wheel.  Especially difficult when one is in manual mode and manual focus.  Then the wheel is used for exposure as well as for focusing and its a nuisance to keep the wheel switched to the desired purpose.  The controls force the user to concentrate on the controls and not the subject.  Much better to have separate controls for these 3 MAJOR variants, or at a minimum, a separate button to switch between purposes.- Exposure compensation button has been removed - its now difficult to find and use.- confusing screen display.  The simulated analog wheel is confusing to understand, and occupies a far bigger proportion of the display than it should - it blocks out the very subject that one is trying to photograph.- The noise level in dark conditions is just NOT acceptable.PANASONIC, for future models:-- Please increase the size of the cmos.- Please improve noise.- Please change controls (how about 2 of the previous 'joystick'-type buttons side-by-side for Aperture and S Speed, and wheel (without preset clicks/graduations) for focus.- PLEASE make the display flexible - let the user include/exclude information and placement.- PLEASE size the filter threads so that a UV filter AND a polarizing filter will not show up in the corners of the picture.- Please include a lens hood.- Revert the menu dial back to previous configuration - MUST have exposure compensation easily accessible.- Please charge more for camera but include those features.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the price
Reviews.Author: Dr. G. Sarrazin
Reviews.Content: As expected, cheaper than the competition and as good as the competition. Very good when you travel and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Really need an owners manual
Reviews.Author: Marion D. Dickinson
Reviews.Content: I love the camera, but it is much different that my other Lumix FZ cameras, and I really really needed an owners manual to take to Yellowstone with me the day after I got it.  I was not expecting too much considering the extreme zoom and the price, but it takes very good shots even on iA.  Being sure the image stabilizer is on if very difficult to ascertain.  If it costs too much to include the complete manual, make it an option at an increased price, or include one in English and make other languages available on the net.  In fact I am still trying to figure out how to change the f.stop on it for more depth of field. One of the best buys around all things considered, especially for those who shoot wildlife.

Reviews.Title: Not As good as my FZ200
Reviews.Author: G. F. THOMAS "fredth"
Reviews.Content: I have an FZ200 and am very pleased with it so far. I thought I would like the extra zoom on the FZ70. The photos are to soft and Just out of focus on the ones I tried.I wanted to like this camera ,but it does not come close to the FZ200 in photo quality. I have tried the same settings that I use on my other cameras and was not pleased with the results at all.Another fault was when I tried to work with RAW on my MAC. I found out it will not work with iPhoto or Aperture as of this date,maybe in the future. I can enlarge photos from my FZ200 and get a lot better results for the wildlife photos i take than this camera. So back it goes. I am not sure ,but think some of the difference is lens quality between the two cameras. The FZ200 has a Leica lens.

Reviews.Title: I don't get really good pictures with it!
Reviews.Author: elam
Reviews.Content: I tried the IA and IA+ with this camera and took many pictures in different conditions.  Most of them came out to be unsatisfactory.  The outdoor ones were better than the indoor ones.  I also changed the picture resolutions to try, but I was still not happy with the results.  The video worked better.  Overall, a bit disappointing!

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Gloria
Reviews.Content: I love this camara, it is amazing what you can do with it and its zoom is awsome. The only down side I think it feals a little fragile.

Reviews.Title: Wife loves it
Reviews.Author: Mike Hames
Reviews.Content: First camera she is reading the manual to see what else it can do.  Love the details of birds  at 60x

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Charles Arnspiger "ScA"
Reviews.Content: This is the first camera of any sort that approaches the performance I want. It can take handheld night pictures of the sky that rival telescopes. It takes pictures that are worthy of being taken and printed. I hope I never have to replace this camera. A few minor shortcomings, but insignificant compared to performance.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Harvey
Reviews.Content: I had been searching for a new camera for some time.  This camera does almost everything I want in a new camera.  Since it came from Amazon, every aspect of the purchase came off without a hitch.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Jorge A.  Rodríguez A.
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this purchase. It is an excellent device. It has worked very well. I recommend this camera to others people.

Reviews.Title: Takes great pictures
Reviews.Author: Patricia M. Ekiss
Reviews.Content: I like the view finder - sometimes it works better than the display - especially in bright light. The increased functionality of having manual controls makes it more flexible than an automatic camera.  The long zoom is also a big plus when taking wildlife shots.

Reviews.Title: So far - so good.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Dizzyb"
Reviews.Content: I'm giving the camera four stars since I'm still learning how to use all the settings but so far I love the camera.

Reviews.Title: No need for binoculars!
Reviews.Author: Amir Findling
Reviews.Content: I'm still discovering its numerous features. But I definitely like what I have seen so far. Yes, a monopod/tripod help at high power zoom values, but that is to be expected. Would've if the screen had swivel/tilt, but this was not a surprise to me. I can live with that.

Reviews.Title: loving my camera
Reviews.Author: carol frye
Reviews.Content: Pictutes are so clear and colors are vibrant.  I love it.  going on road trip to capture the beautiful leaves.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality
Reviews.Author: ontheroadjg
Reviews.Content: I am trading in my FZ150 and replacing it with this unit.  The zoom is wonderful and for the landscape pictures I take, it is great.  You really don't need a telescopic lens when you have this unit.  The picture quality is excellent and the camera well balanced.  Good job, Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Lumix FZ-70
Reviews.Author: Thomas Rose
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera.  The only problem I have with it is, when you blow up a wide angle shot it comes out fuzzy.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Photogal
Reviews.Content: The camera does have good zoom power but the picture quality is not what I had expected.  It is also difficult to get clear focus when using the zoom.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera - Still Learning Features
Reviews.Author: M. Camp.
Reviews.Content: I'm new to this camera and new to super zoom cameras, but likewhat I've seen so far.  I'll post a picture of a football gamein normal view then in 60x view when I figure out how to addcustomer photos.

Reviews.Title: Excited to use this as my side arm
Reviews.Author: L. Pachuta "lisalyn"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a carry around. I shoot with D3s and D600 Nikons.  Everything seems great so far. I had an older FZ model years ago that I loved and am excited about this one.  I have not yet figured out how to set aperture in manual mode so if anyone knows please comment.  I do think it's lame that Amazon dropped the price as soon as the pre-ordered cameras were shipped.

Reviews.Title: Looks Good to Me!
Reviews.Author: John T. Jones
Reviews.Content: I read from one reviewer that he did not like the images. My concern was focus. Side dug out my window mount because you must have a steady mount if you're going to take pictures at high magnification. Now in the book it says something about pushing the button halfway down and the focus button. I haven't got the hang of that yet, so I will have to read the book. But just using the camera like I did with my old Panasonic, pushing the capture button down halfway until I see the green image box, I got some pretty good pictures. I also got some out of focus pictures because I was fiddling around trying to use that focus button. Like I say, I got to go back to the manual.I learned that I can use the 60 X manual focus but that I'm not restricted to that. I noticed that I could get up to 120 X digital .I was worried about buying this camera because of the battery. I gave my other Panasonic to my granddaughter because when I'm birding,I don't want a dead battery. So let not have problems with this, I ordered to back up batteries.I did not buy a new memory card because I had one. That food in the camera and after four shots, it said the card was full. Well it only had four shots on. I have put back in the camera level tested again but it looks like I will be buying a new card.I'll let you know how things go for me.John

Reviews.Title: DMC-FZ70 camera
Reviews.Author: Eitan Darel "ED"
Reviews.Content: It is a nice product in it's category, wide angle to super tele in one lens. I compared it to mirror less Samsung NX2000with 20-50mm and 50-200mm lenses, and DSLR camera 18-200mm, looking for reasonable quality photos.The camera is big, almost the size of DSLR. Too big for alternate camera.Pictures in a sunny day the images were nice, but a bit soft. In a room (without flash) the camera enhanced the color and brightness, to look like a picture that processed using Photoshop, In dark room it was much worst.The Samsung NX2000 that has bigger sensor, was much more accurate, and the pictures, were much better, no blurry photos. The touch screen/screen resolution made it nice experience.The real deal is when you look at the pictures, when you send them to print. it was obvious that the Panasonic was not good enough, the Samsung NX2000 was on the edge, and both could not be compared to the DSLR.The NX2000 and the DSLR were almost equal in outdoor sunny day photograpy, but the Panasonic quality was not there.Inside the house the differences could be seen especially in lower light. In Zooms beyond 200 you need a tripod, using the Panasonic in ~600nn zoom, it was hard to stay on the object, the Samsung with 50-200mm with 2x digital zoom, and 1.5x factor, was much easier to use.I graded the Panasonic with  3 stars, as it is reasonably priced for whatever you get. For $200 (or less) more The NX 2000 with 2 lenses is a better deal.The problem is that when you take a photo, and you want to get the best results, and the image is not good, sometimes you can not duplicate that moment.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: Still need to learn how to use all the features but so far we like it.  (Again word requirement stupid.....why don't you guys just send out words/sentences and just let us pick the closest comments to our real experience.............did the people who design this software also work on the President's health care website?

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Neill Southwick
Reviews.Content: Image quality is very good IMO. I still have lots more testing to do in this area however.  The 20mm wide shots are amazing. My FZ150 has a 25mm wide and this camera appears to take in approx. 20% more coverage. I was able to shoot at max zoom and get good results hand holding the camera. This was in bright sunlight so with less light I wouldn't expect such good results. I really dislike the on/off switch. Hard to move and feels like it will break easily. On the physical positive side the shape of the grip is excellent. The palm of your hand makes full contact with the camera. Much better than my FZ150. I also like the slightly raised Video button and its location. I can find it by feel now. The wheel on the back of the FZ70 is a huge improvement over the one on the FZ150. It sticks out more now and is easy to turn. I've only had the camera in my hands since yesterday and will add more impressions as I get deeper into it but except for the lousy on/off switch I'm quite impressed at this point.Here's my update.After quite extensive testing comparing the zooms on my FZ150 with the FZ70 I decided to return the FZ70. I can crop the shots taken with the FZ150 to equal the reach of the FZ70 and I actually like the results from the FZ150 better. I tired various settings on both cameras so I'd be comparing apples with apples as close as possible. The big attraction for me with the FZ70 was the extra zoom but if I can get the same IQ cropping my FZ150 shots that cancels out the main advantage of the FZ70 for me.  Also I found I really missed the articulated LCD that the FZ150 has.  I will miss the 20mm wide angle and the great grip on the FZ70. I won't miss that terrible ON/OFF switch on the FZ70.  I feared every time I moved that switch it was going to break. I loved the wheel and Video button on the FZ70 however. Hey, I won't have to buy an LA8 adaptor tube to attach my Olympus TCON 1.7X lens to this FZ70 now.  Cheers everybody, I'll still be following your comments.  Maybe Pany will come out with an FZ250-300 in the future. I'll just have to wait and see.

Reviews.Title: No disappointments here.
Reviews.Author: Robert Frisco
Reviews.Content: I took the camera on vacation and loved having it.  The zoom was amazing.  Sure there is a little jiggle at 60x's, but that is to be expected.  I love that you can use filters on it which the FZ40 did not and thus you had to be very protective of the lens.  I'd recommend this to anyone who does not want to carry around a second zoom lens along with their DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Big Zoom but Poor Image Quality UPDATED
Reviews.Author: A. R. Hanford
Reviews.Content: Update 03/20/2014:I am so glad I returned this camera! The Sony mentioned below has been incredible, taking great shots and creating wonderful images all in a compact package.  I would definitely recommend skipping this Panasonic for something else.Original review:The FZ70 seemed really exciting on paper, but in reality the picture quality was disappointing.  Images were frequently washed out and had a soft appearance.  About one in ten photos was acceptable, a problem compounded by the fact this was hard to determine until the photos were downloaded and viewed on the computer.  As far as the zoom lens, most of the zoom range was unattainable with handheld use.  Even in full sun there was significant blur.  Zoomed in, the washed out look became even more pronounced.On a bright note, the camera did take good indoor shots with nice color and flash distribution.  Subjects were rarely washed out by the flash.  Focus was also relatively fast.I had the FZ70 for about a week and decided to return it for the Sony DSC-HX50V/B 20.4MP Digital Camera with 3-Inch LCD Screen (Black).  I've had the Sony for a day and already I prefer the Sony in almost every way.  It's lighter and smaller, the zoom lens covers about as much territory as you can use without a tripod, and the image quality is significantly better.

Reviews.Title: Saturation
Reviews.Author: Adrienne Burack
Reviews.Content: The simple deviations from the set features are buried in the various menu selections.  They should be easier to access.  So far, even with a polarizer, the photos were a little overexposed and it took a while until I found the exposure compensation control so that my pictures could be slightly underexposed, giving me more saturation.

Reviews.Title: Lens was slow
Reviews.Author: GMC
Reviews.Content: The lens was not as good as I expected.  The pictures were soft and the lens was slow to focus.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: Ruoyang
Reviews.Content: Just a camera for practicing before I get a more professional one, I have to say it's qualified for that.

Reviews.Title: If you don't care about image quality, it's a great camera
Reviews.Author: appletree
Reviews.Content: My first camera in this line was the FZ 28. It was great. When the FZ 35 came out the following year, I bought it. It was much better than the 28. I was thrilled to get the increased zoom and mega pixels when the FZ 40 arrived, and the image quality continued to be outstanding, although fewer images were keepers which I attributed to the difficulty of controlling hand-shake at the larger zoom factor. I have purchased new cameras in the line every year since, and have returned all of them with great sadness after trying and failing to produce images that were even close to satisfactory, especially when compared to those taken with the earlier models. I suspect that the problem lies in the difference between CCD and CMOS sensors, although the FZ 47 was a CCD model and it was no better and much worse than the FZ 40. I am sure there are other features, video for example, that are better in the new models. However, if high-resolution, sharp, clear images that capture the beauty of nature in its most realistic rendering is a priority for you, as it is for me, your best bet is to by a used FZ 40, or a FZ 35. I have purchased 4 of the former and 2 of the latter as I am coming to the painful conclusion that Panasonic has abandoned the high-quality image business. I would switch to another manufacturer if I could find one that offered standard threads on their high-end point-and-shoot cameras.As unhappy as I have been returning the cameras, I am very impressed and grateful to Amazon for their incredibly generous and pleasant customer service. I would be reluctant to buy a camera anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: canon SX50 vs FZ70
Reviews.Author: Hawk
Reviews.Content: Can anyone give your opinion in the difference of cameras and photo quality of both the SX50 and FZ70,, at the 20mm and 1200mm. Would you give up your Canon SX50 for the FZ70?

Reviews.Title: Lumix FZ70
Reviews.Author: whitehawk
Reviews.Content: This camera is not user friendly.The manual that comes with it is vague and hard to understand,and poorly written.The camera is difficult to navigate through, and the focus is not sharp or clear. I was very disappointed in this camera and its performance.I would not recommend it to a novice user.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ70
Reviews.Author: jpa45
Reviews.Content: Overall, it's a good camera and takes good quality pictures. The main downfall I have and the reason for an average rating is because the booklet show a port for a remote but the camera does not have one. This is one model that does not allow for a remote shutter release.I contacted Panasonic and was not happy with the response. I doesn't look like the plan to make a remote shutter release for this model.Very disaapointed!!!!

Reviews.Title: zoom
Reviews.Author: luis e yegres
Reviews.Content: so far the camera acomplish what i expected, I wish it could have a manual zoom. may be later I can have a better oppinion on it

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ70 A camera that was a disappointment
Reviews.Author: T. Griffin
Reviews.Content: Heavy in overall feeling and the Panasonic Lumix point-and-shoot that I currently have (14 MP) performs far better with both natural light and low light. the DMC-FZ70 lens comes with a cheap plastic lens cover that - unless one is very cautious with applying - could easily scratch the lens - Panasonic could do far better with a different - and yes, not cheap - lens cover. I returned it because of these above factors. the beauty of purchasing via Amazon. No problems.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ70 A camera that was a disappointment
Reviews.Author: T. Griffin
Reviews.Content: Heavy in overall feeling and the Panasonic Lumix point-and-shoot that I currently have (14 MP) performs far better with both natural light and low light. the DMC-FZ70 lens comes with a cheap plastic lens cover that - unless one is very cautious with applying - could easily scratch the lens - Panasonic could do far better with a different - and yes, not cheap - lens cover. I returned it because of these above factors. the beauty of purchasing via Amazon. No problems.

Reviews.Title: LOVE the Camera...but if U Have a MAC...SOFTWARE SUCKS!
Reviews.Author: Sharon L. Jones "sljones"
Reviews.Content: I love the camera, BUT for a mac user, Panasonic uses a proprietary raw2 format. iPhoto and Aperture will NOT recognize the photos in raw2.."unreadable files". NOWHERE does Panasonic mention this. You need to download SilkyPix (for free) BUT WHOAAAA...it is SOOOOOO difficult it put me in tears. There is no export button, I took an hour to look for export or even SAVE ....NOTHING. I figured how to convert to tiff (thinking iPhoto would recognize that) and I think it saved....BUT TO WHERE???? There is no option to save to a folder, or the desktop.Forget the Silkypix manual. If you are proficient w Photoshop this might be okay..but I am not. I want a user friendly camera and user friendly iphoto to process my photos. I want raw to save to the external hard drive... but with this program it is IMPOSSIBLE. You have to telephone JAPAN!!!! For goodness sake Panasonic. The software is a "DEVELOPER'S TOOL"!!!! Really????? As a 'bridge' camera, this is for non-professionals....so the software needs to be user friendly.And Panasonic free 800 tech support is just as worthless. He said I needed to contact Apple if iPhoto didn't recognize raw2. As it is ONLY panasonic that uses it, it should be panasonic to supply a user friendly photo processing, NOT this JUNK!! And really, the Silkypix manual is as difficult as the program..NOWHERE does the manual explain how to save to desktop. NOT AT ALL! The directions looses much in translation.If raw is important to you, and yu have a mac, keep this in mind. I am truly thinking of sending this back. The absolute lack of support is troubling!I have added the following to CNET reviews of this camera...I hope you find it helpful.I bought this camera and LOVE it. Sharp, retina colors..just beautiful BUT the raw is misleading. It is raw2, which is proprietary to Panasonic, and for a Mac user , iPhoto  does a "unreadable files". So contacted the 800 number and Panasonic rep was useless...told me to contact Apple! REALLY! So tried again w online chat and was told needed to download Silkypix, free and for Mac. WOW...unless your a tech 'geek' this software is sooooooo difficult it left me in tears.  The Silkypix manual, looses a great deal in translation and is like the program..a "developers tool"! It is toooo difficult to read and understand. All I wanted to do is take one of the raw2  files, convert to Tiff so I could use in iPhoto or Aperture.  Learned how to convert..BUT no Export button, no save button..no way to export to external  desktop folder and I still can't find the photo I converted. Was so upset deleted program and sent a very angry letter to Silkypix and Panasonic.So if raw is important to you and you use a Mac, you better be VERY knowledgeable in technical terms  or Photoshop because this is way too difficult for an ordinary person to understand. I don't use Photoshop because I find it  difficult to use. I am not a professional photographer, and this is a 'bridge' camera...so Panasonic needs to get rid of Silkypix and use a "user friendly" program or get rid of raw2 and use raw.As for the adaptors, they are available on Panasonic's website and Amazon. I did but a uv filter to attach to protect the lens, and other accessories. The video in 1080 is wonderful and I just love this camera, especially for the $358 price I paid on Amazon (plus free shipping and no tax!) BUT I have been taught by my friends at the photo club to always have raw files, and not just jpeg. So I have an external hard drive I keep all my photos on. As I get better at the software I can go back to the raw and process better, but for now it is a steep learning curve for me.  I expected more from Panasonic, this Silkypix program actually and truly  SUCKS! (about the best expression I could use in mixed company that fits the bill!)

Reviews.Title: Camera seems fine but not all parts were there!
Reviews.Author: Amy Hyland
Reviews.Content: Although I was buying a "open box" product I expected that all items would be in the box, however that wasn't the case, the camera was just thrown in the box, battery was loose and there was NO battery charger included!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful
Reviews.Author: Belinda Burton "Belinda Burton "Animal Ma...
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased for a disabled person who has tendency to drop things.  I have a friend who purchased this and she is a semi professional photographer....she suggested that I buy this for this person.

Reviews.Title: 60X ??
Reviews.Author: D. Rosenfeld
Reviews.Content: After comparing other zoom cameras and optical systems I can safely say that the zoom is only 40X at the most. Also, there are no instructions as to how to format a SD card. The image stabilization system is EXCELLENT!!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic website shows Leica lens which is NOT on FZ70
Reviews.Author: BudNJax
Reviews.Content: I bought an FZ70 based on the Panasonic.com website, which clearly shows the camera with a Leica lens: [...]Sorry, the camera actually has a Lumix DC-Vario lens, which may or may not be made and/or licensed by Leica, but it's clearly NOT a Leica lens, false advertising by Panasonic? I think so.  While I have not had a chance to try out the camera very much, my impression is that it feels like cheap plastic, the viewfinder is tiny and grainy and the eyeglass correction lens frequently gets out of adjustment.  You get a very basic manual with the camera, if you want to know everything about the settings, etc they are on an enclosed CD or you can download it from the Panasonic website. I bought this to take on a cruise where hauling around a couple DSLRs and lenses is not very practical if you also wish to enjoy yourself.  I'll take a backup camera, too, just in case!

Reviews.Title: Poor quality for zoom
Reviews.Author: RDS
Reviews.Content: Expectations of the zoom were probably too high for a point and shoot.  This camera did not stand up to good quality photos.  Slow camera also.  I returned it for a full refund due to be so disappointed.  Canon has a much better processor in it.

Reviews.Title: FZ70
Reviews.Author: Allan Hawkins V
Reviews.Content: Pana said is a 20mm lens but when you get the picture, you can see that is really a 21mm lens. If you like bulky cameras, as me, this is a lovely camera, full zoom is ok but depends on you, I mean if you have good stability in your arms or no, if you don't you will need the tripod. I didn't see any difference with my others Lumix with Leica lens with this with Lumix Vario lens, so is not a big issue. I bought because the supposed 20mm wide-angle, that's the reason of one star. Battery life is ok, more than 250 pictures with a full charge and the camera always on.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment....
Reviews.Author: firefly
Reviews.Content: First, I must state that I have NOT purchased this camera. My "disappointment" is due to the fact that this model DOES NOT HAVE A LEICA LENS. This was the great selling point of their cameras. I have four (4) of them, all "basic" point and shoot. I have been an amateur photographer for 35 or so years....have seen and used various brands/styles, film (slides and prints, different kinds of films) and digital. Also have Pentax, Nikon, Kodak cameras (SLRs and P&S;).Panasonic stands out as an superb camera. So much so, I generally use my point and shoot far more than my SLR (unless taking pictures of birds). Having a Leica lens makes it the Cadillac of point and shoots. I primary do landscape/birds. Many of my birding friends who have them...when doing work where the object isn't so "flighty" (!)or far away ...love their Panasonics. BUT....without a Leica lens, I'm sorry. It's just another camera. They were going to release this model back in June of this year, without a viewfinder (a problem for me) but it stil had a Leica lens. For some reason they never actually released it, and then around August it came out again, with a viewfinder but not a Leica lens. Go figure.If you look at their web site for this model, the original version is still showing with Leica on the lens at the beginning of the description, but the current version is used in the remainder of the description and there's no Leica name on the lens.After reading other reviews, I contacted Panasonic to verify. The guy I talked to had no clue. He went online to check. Duh. I already did that and then some. Insulting, to say the least. He verified the FZ60 has the Leica lens, but it "appeared" the FZ70 did not. Gee, thanks for wasting my time.Bottom line, whatever camera, in my book it isn't the camera itself....it's the lens. I have to decide whether I'm going with the FZ60 or a Cannon.
